title: Basic Physics & Movement
overview: Implement realistic movement with velocity, acceleration, friction, and gravity for engaging gameplay.

sections.title: Game Physics Basics

miniProject.title: Platformer Character Controller
miniProject.description: Create smooth platformer movement with gravity and jumping
steps: Create player with position and velocity
Implement variable jump height (hold for higher)

questions.question: What is velocity?
questions.explanation: Velocity is how fast position changes (distance/time).

questions.question: Why is gravity positive in most game code?
questions.explanation: Canvas Y increases downward, so positive gravity pulls down.

questions.question: How to make friction frame-independent?
questions.explanation: Power function makes friction frame-rate independent.

questions.question: Good platformer feel requires?
questions.explanation: Responsive platformers use gravity, air control, and forgiveness mechanics.

questions.question: What is coyote time in platformers?
questions.correctAnswer: A short grace period after leaving a platform where the player can still jump, making controls feel more responsive and forgiving
questions.explanation: Coyote time improves game feel by being slightly generous with jump timing.

setupSteps: Use canvas starter with game loop
Set appropriate physics constants (tune for your game)
Add debug display for velocity values

troubleshooting.solution: Adjust velocity constants. Remember to multiply by deltaTime for frame independence.
Check: 1) Ground detection working? 2) Applying jump force once? 3) Using fixed jump velocity?
